ygData.msgSnippet: ... Mipmapping basically takes textures that are further off and blurs them. When you draw a texture full resolution at long range they tend to swim and it
ygData.messageBody:
> From: "James Archer" <james@...>
>
> Do Not go to Glide mode. That is for 3dfx chips only. as for mipmaping i
> think (and feel free to correct me) that has something to do with texture
> bluring, but not sure.

Mipmapping basically takes textures that are further off and blurs them.
When you draw a texture full resolution at long range they tend to "swim"
and it also gives a better feeling of distance imo. If you're looking at a
tree hundreds of yards away, you shouldn't be able to see the individual
leaves anymore.
